website_summaries.verdict: The KitchenAid Siphon Brewer runs automatically, uses electricity for extra convenience and brews distinctly flavorful coffee but is tricky to keep clean and operate.
pros: The KitchenAid Siphon Brewer makes superbly rich siphon filter coffee automatically and with standard electric power
cons: It requires more time and effort to clean than drip devices and its lightly filtered brew may be an acquired taste for some

customer_reviews.title: Follow up review: now the handle cracked open. I hope it won’t fall apart before 6 months. I’m not sure if this thing will last.
customer_reviews.text: I like my new coffee maker. Easy to clean. My only complaint, the power switch light gave up after just 2 months. Even if I’ve been very careful not to wet the turn on switch. 7/13/18 For a few days, I noticed a slight cracking on the bottom handle. While I was washing it, the handle just broke. By the way, the top handle that split open a while back, I was able to glue. I just bought this siphon coffee brewer barely 5 mo the ago! All my appliances are Kitchenaid. This one is a complete failure. So frustrating. I’m calling the manufacturer. 7/16/18 After several phone conversations, my Siphon Coffeemaker will be replaced with no extra charge.
customer_reviews.author: L. Kahn

customer_reviews.title: It takes a little longer but totally worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker makes the best coffee in my opinion. It is fairly easy to use but takes a little more time to brew and clean than drip coffee makers or k-cups but the resulting coffee is totally worth it. It makes smooth, bright coffee that is not as bitter as other methods. Plus watching the process is entertaining. Love this machine.
customer_reviews.author: De Provence

customer_reviews.title: there are better products out there
customer_reviews.text: This is a lovely coffee pot. It works satisfactorily. The problem is that the brewed coffee is nice but not exceptional in flavor. It doesn't compete with my Behmor, as example. It is also difficult to manage the spent grounds. They must be washed out of the upper pot and carefully captured if you don't want to send them down the sink and stop up the drain. It is an extra step that is messy. That would be OK if the end result was exceptional cup of coffee - it isn't.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: The finest and smoothest coffee you will "EVER", drink!
customer_reviews.text: I love coffee. And I have tried it all over the world. If you love coffee? You will not be disappointed with this "Siphon", type Brewer! I make coffee very strong indeed, In fact, for what "I", call coffee? I use "Two cups of very coarsely ground coffee", "Per full pot"! That's strong coffee! But Smoooooth....With this brewer! Because it is brewed correctly, Every time! Very "Similar" to how strong a cup of '"Joe", that they make and drink in Bogota "Columbia", or "Turkey". And this coffee maker does its job perfectly EVERY time!!! And "Smooth"? Isn't even the word for the coffee that these make! Worth EVERY penny and more!!
customer_reviews.author: Don B. Astuped

customer_reviews.title: Very happy , quick, delicous coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee as good as french press which is my favorite, but faster and easier. Just put the coffee on top water in the bottom and flip the switch, very fast. Rich delicious coffee. Like all Kitchen Aid products it's very sturdy, extra important for a glass product, the glass is extra thick. A little awkward to clean but not bad. Uses a little more coffee than drip or french press. If you're on a budget I'd say go french press, if you have the money try this, if you like great coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Reseda guy

customer_reviews.title: It make a great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: It make a great cup of coffee. My wife just loves it. Guess come to our house and they like to watch how it works. Only had one problem with it. A handle broke off after we had it about a month and my wife called the warranty department and they sent the whole piece rather than just a handle. That was a no question asked and hassle free.
customer_reviews.author: Karen & Larry Lyson

customer_reviews.title: Got this as a gift for a young coffee connoisseur
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my niece. I was told she grinds her own bean every morning. After visiting a local coffee shop that does siphon coffee I knew this was the gift for her. It was delivered while the family was visiting on her birthday. They pulled it out of the box and made a pot of coffee with her favorite brand. Several people said it was the best cup of coffee they had ever had. Read up on the science behind the siphon method. People swear buy it. I am just witnessing the voice of the people. PS. Don't forget to get extra filters.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Goodlett

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Warning, this will ruin all other coffee makers for you. I bought this for my wife and a few weeks later we went on a month long trip...we couldn't enjoy the coffee at any of the air bnb we stayed at after drinking siphon brewer cofee. Cleaning isn't as much of a pain some some people make it out to be, I've had coffee makers that are far more annoying to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Konyn

customer_reviews.title: A descent coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: The KitchenAid Siphon or Vacuum coffee pot does what it is supposed to do, make coffee. As several have said, the grounds are not that easy to clean out but it is not a deal breaker. The biggest drawback is the pot does not come in a larger size for additional drinkers, most people drink a mug and not a cup (8 oz) of coffee. The carafe and siphon top could simply be made taller and wider, respectively.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Received on 3/28/29. Barely 5 months later I noticed it wasn’t vacuuming the coffee into the pot. The magnet which holds the pieces together corroded through the plastic seal. Any coffee pot should last longer than a few months.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Reminiscent of French Press
customer_reviews.text: We love this coffee pot. Our technivorm pour over coffee pot bit the dust, which put us on the hunt for a new one. This pot produces a nice rich pot of coffee with a little bit of sediment in the bottom, kind of like french press coffee. UPDATE: 6 months in we broke the siphon globe and are unable to find a replacement. 😩
customer_reviews.author: Susan Brooks

customer_reviews.title: 2nd best purchase
customer_reviews.text: It was tough to spend this much on a coffee brewer, however once I got it, I felt the caffeine jitters opening the box. While it is a pain to clean up, what isn't that's worth while, am I right? I digress, grind coffee, put in the top, put water in the bottom, hit the switch - coffee heaven. If you thought drinking two pots of coffee would be tough, you'd be wrong. I had to retype this 8 times because my body is shaking violently, but the flavor is worth it. Oh, buy decent coffee, maybe go half caf...
customer_reviews.author: Matt S.

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee pot - don't buy from "always quality" seller
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of this coffee pot I've owned. Love it - brews great coffee and it is a nice conversational piece. One of Amazon's sellers, "always quality" sold this one to me. After only 3 months the handle broke on the bottom carafe. When calling KitchenAid for a warranty replacement, they said it was over 4 years old - not new like it indicates on Amazon. Buy this from another seller on Amazon or from another store.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Beats drip.  Pretty decent
customer_reviews.text: This beats drip. It's easy to use as far as brewing. Cleaning less so. Our upper brew chamber "carafe" just broke this morning after 6 months use. Cost of replacement is half the replacement cost of a whole machine. Not sure how this happened. I always use the stand to hand wash it in the sink, so i didn't even bump the glass. The glass spider webbed near the base. So it's a good machine, but the cost is debatable when you have to invest another $100 in six months.
customer_reviews.author: D. POOLE

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: It's just okay. That's the truth. I buy a higher grade of coffee, and I cannot tell the difference between coffee from this machine and my coffee from my old machine. This machine is faster. Too expensive for what it is. I wanted to return it, but AFTER my purchase I see that the seller won't accept returns if I have tried the product and am unsatisfied. $160 down the drain as far as I am concerned.
customer_reviews.author: BanditQueen

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee.
customer_reviews.text: This coffeemaker makes great coffee. The best. I find it's easier, and just as good, not to use the fabric filter. The eight cup line actually makes three good sized mugs. I'm hooked on the flavor. I do set it up the night before and turn the switch on when I get up. It takes about six minutes start to finish. I'm very happy with this product. Cleaning will be a labor of love, but I hand wash my dishes so it's really no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor nightmare to clean
customer_reviews.text: The coffee is absolutely amazing and it is the coolest thing to use. Cleaning it ... is horrible! But if your a coffee advocate like me , I’ll put up with it. Your hand will not fit in the top to ever dry it so that’s a fun task and you do have to use the brush provided to really clean it because of the ridges inside on the base. Also, if you drop either part...still I have no idea what replacements look like and that makes me wonder if what I paid was worth it or not considering there are cheaper ones on the market
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Eisler

customer_reviews.title: Too large for my needs
customer_reviews.text: The coffee pot is really a conversation piece and beautiful and clean to look at. Seems to be sturdy and built well. I did not keep it because it was too large for my needs as a single person. Cannot tell you how it made the coffee taste because I did not keep it.
customer_reviews.author: carol taschetti

customer_reviews.title: A real pain to clean! & doesn't have warming element

The other brand I had did & would keep coffee at a constant temp without burning. With this said I wouldn't recommend this product & wouldn't purchase again. It's more about the design rather than quality. I think Kitchen Aid makes quality products but need to work on the design of this particular one!
customer_reviews.author: Debi Mason

customer_reviews.title: It just tastes better

Yes, it is fun to watch the brewing cycle, but if it did not taste better, so what. I find letting the grounds cool and dry makes cleaning the brewing carafe easier; but you might not. I also find a lighter roast tastes better than a darker roast.

customer_reviews.text: Pretty difficult to empty the carafe completely. It has a relatively small opening that also makes it hard to clean.

customer_reviews.text: Was excited to see this since we LOVE Siphon coffee makers and had them before, but this fails to tell you that the coffee does not stay hot. We had to return for this reason. Baun use to make a great Siphon style easy to use coffee maker- guess we will still be on the search for one.

customer_reviews.text: I make coffee once a week. It took me three Sunday's to make coffee that taste like coffee. The machine itself is NOT easy to navigate, cleaning the coffee pot itself is cumbersome, my hand has to squeeze through the top to clean the bottom of the pot, ouch, you cannot put this coffeemaker in the dishwasher, it also DOES NOT have a warming cycle, UGH. This machine can make a decent cup of coffee, but IF I were to purchase another coffeemaker I personally would get a easier system. C. Riley

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, a little hard to clean.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Bodum electric with this one. The Bodum was plastic and discolored, also it brewed for a shorter time. This brewer is glass so it looks much better. Because it brews longer I use less coffee than before. This brewer is a little harder to clean because the openings are narrow. You have to be careful not to break it because it is glass. You also have to be careful that the unit is sealed, I have to look at the connection because the feel of closing is not much different. 4 stars due to hard to clean and sealing. Overall the best electric vacuum coffee maker on the market at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Vette

customer_reviews.title: We really enjoy the KitchenAid Siphon Coffee Brewer
customer_reviews.text: We really enjoy the KitchenAid Siphon Coffee Brewer. It makes a great pot of coffee and it is interesting to watch. Unfortunately, the quality of the materials is not great. We are on our third "mixing bowl" from breakage or handle separation. The lower piece, the pot, has sections where the plastic handle has broken away, separated, or split. The split on the top ring breaks the suction necessary for the siphon action to work, which is critical to brewing the coffee. To be fair, KitchenAid is sending a new pot but honestly, the materials should be of a better quality.
customer_reviews.author: DocM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent flavor, works well, but, not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Great flavor and, relatively, easy to use. Only real drawback is the shape of the carafe. Shoulder if the carafe makes it clumsy to pour out the last of the coffee. I'm unsure of how this could be remedied, but narrow neck makes cleaning less than easy. Also invest in cloth filters. They seem to last a good while, but, they aint cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Louie

customer_reviews.title: I love my Kitchenaid Siphon Brewer

customer_reviews.title: I have not be disappointed. I like my coffee strong and this machine ...

customer_reviews.title: By far the best coffee you will brew on your own
customer_reviews.text: By far the best coffee you will brew on your own. This brewer makes coffee with so much body and flavor yet it is not burnt or acidic tasting. Easy to use and easier to clean then my old peculator or French Press. If you want to warm up your coffee just leave the carafe on the base and push the one switch again. customer_reviews.title: WARNING the handle can break off
customer_reviews.text: The coffee it made was great. It was very easy to operate. That is why I was disappointed when the handle broke off the pot. The plastic attachment at the end closest to the open pot, cracked off. I talked to the manufacturer and was told the pot was out of warranty. Based on the KitchenAid reputation, I felt confidently that I would be using it 10 years longer. I ordered the KA pot on 11/14/15 and it broke 9/4/17. On the day it broke, I ordered a Cuisinart which is on the job everyday.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Final a coffee maker that makes a great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: We are foodies and when we would go out to nice restaurants the end of the meal would be coffee from a vacuum coffee maker. It is the best way to make a cup of coffee. We looked on line for the pots that the restaurants have but they are expensive and take a degree in chemistry to run. That is not the case with the Kitchenaid siphon coffee maker. The steps are quite easy to follow and there is only one switch to throw and the pot does the rest. A true home run for Kitchenaid. If you like a great cup of coffee in the morning this is what you need.

product_meta.title: KitchenAid KCM0812OB Siphon Coffee Brewer, Onyx Black, 2.3
product_meta.description:
Color:Onyx Black

The science and complex flavor of siphon brewing comes from vapor pressure pushing the water up through the siphon tube. Then, vacuum suction and gravity draw the coffee down through the grounds. KitchenAid has simplified this process to extract a cup of coffee that showcases all the distinctive flavors of your favorite beans. 

Showcasing the theatrical artistry of siphon brewing, our brewer is made of high quality glass and stainless steel to be a true thing of beauty. View the full immersion vacuum brewing process from start to finish resulting in a complex and velvety cup of craft coffee right at home. 

Easily brew 3-8 cups of siphon style coffee.
feature_bullets: Automated full immersion siphon brewing delivered through precise temperature and vacuum technology.
Brew unit stand securely holds brew unit once brewing is complete.
Flavor Profile: Bright and rich with a clean finish.
Premium glass construction with stainless steel accents.
Magnetic locking seal securely fastens the brew unit and carafe together.
Includes siphon coffee brewer, cleaning brush/coffee scoop, brew unit stand, dual purpose lid, 360° rotation removable base, reusable stainless steel filter and cloth filter pack.
